name: Jean-Yves Moyen
content: Page professionnelle de Jean-Yves Moyen Jean-Yves Moyen (LCR team) E-mail: Jean-Yves.Moyen `at` lipn.univ-paris13.fr LIPN Version française Diku Office 24.5.32 ResearchGate Njalsgade 128-132 DK-2300 Copenhagen S ORCID: 0000-0002-6883-6993 ResearcherID: O-5322-2015 Marie Curie fellowship From September 2015 to August 2017, IÂ was MSCA fellow in Copenhagen, under grant 65522 "Walgo". Doctoral Dissertation I have submitted my Doctoral Dissertation (doktordisputats) at the University of Copenhagen. I am a former student of the École Normale Supérieure de Lyon (1997-2001), I defended my PhDthesis in Nancy on the 17th december 2003 (my supervisor was Jean-Yves Marion). From September 2006 on, I am Associate Professor (Maître de conférences) at University Paris 13. In 2015, I got a European Marie Curie fellowship. I took 2 sabbatical years and between September 2015 and August 2017, I'll be Associate Professor at the University of Copenhagen (Denmark). You can download my resume (in french). Research My principal research topic is the automatic analysis of algorithms' complexity, especially the inplicit computationnal complexity theory. The idea is, given an algorithm, to try and find its complexity and, if possible, another algorithm computing hte same function more efficiently. Between September 2015 and August 2017, I'll be Associate Professor at the University of Copenhagen. Since September 2006, I a member of the LCR team from LIPN. I defended my PhDthesis on the 17th December 2003, my supervisor was Jean-Yves Marion. (.ps, .pdf, bibTEX, abstract) List of publications.
